Edited March 7, 2019 by klgraham1013

I've always wanted this, since I started playing KSP. Even just going to Jool can be boring because it takes several minutes. I have a mod for this, but like every gameplay-improving mod I would like it in stock KSP.
There's not an option for "no change" - that kinda skews your results...

Despite this thread being a mess I'd just like to second the suggestion of "faster timewarp speeds". Timewarping out to Eeloo for 6-8 minutes would be fine, if we were actively doing something, but afaik you don't even change science biomes that far out so it ends up being a moment identical to waiting for the game to load. You can't do anything except look at your ship and pan around in IVA. Either skip to the chase and just have KSP reload at the set point (ie fast travel but in space) and have the game run all encounters and flybys of background vessels handled just like as if you were looking at the KSC (not able to view them, but still moving forward with time) but just load with the vessel at the desired point in time. I'd be ok with it, even if it took a loading screen (which would be no different than not having a loading screen and still waiting). Hopefully it can save time. Just an idea.

As a reference, max time warp is 1.5 minutes per year. A Hohmann transfer to Jool takes 3.5 years or about 5 minutes of wait time with no user involvement (extra 10x would be 30s). An Eeloo round-trip would be 10-15 minutes of waiting at max warp (extra 10x would be 1 minute). This feature would cut out minutes of idle time. I recommend only allowing this when the parent body is the sun or in the tracking station.
